Job Title: Video and Motion Graphics Editor

Location: Washington DC-Baltimore Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Blueprint is a full-service political marketing agency that helps clients win. 
Here's how:Running strategic paid advertising campaigns that leverage cutting-edge targeting technologiesCrafting persuasive ads that stickPowering campaigns and organizations through grassroots fundraisingBuilding user-friendly, attractive, and feature-rich websitesDigital and social media strategy We're an energetic and dedicated team who have been churning out top-notch projects fighting for political candidates and progressive causes like reproductive rights, racial justice, the environment, and much, much more. At Blueprint we believe that diversity is one of our biggest strengths and fuels our relentless focus on winning our campaigns.
Are you motivated by progressive causes and creating video content that drives, inspires, and propels action? Do you want to make persuasive and memorable ads that millions of people will see? We’re looking for a motivated and creative video editor/motion graphics designer to join our Creative Team through the 2024 election cycle. As a part of our Creative Team you would: Turn raw scripts into compelling and polished 15 and 30 second ads, along with other short form video content, using Adobe After Effects and Adobe Premiere Pro. This includes:Skillfully combining footage, photographs, stock assets, vector graphics, motion graphics templates, logos, text, music, and sound effects into cohesive end products with a high level of polishEnsuring all edits are seamless and natural to help the story flow effectively, reviewing all final files for quality and consistency before delivery.Creating versions of the video optimized for different platforms (Connected TV, Facebook, Snapchat, etc.)Maintain an organized project file and asset folder structure from start to finish for easy navigation and file retrieval for current, team collaboration, and future needs.Bring your ideas, creativity, and innovation to your work. Contribute to creative brainstorms and concepting.Collaborate with the team to establish and implement best practices, including knowledge of new techniques, formats, and software to improve day-to-day workflow. You’d be a great fit if you have: 3+ years of professional video and motion graphics experience with a strong background/passion for video editing and motion graphic designHighly proficient in working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite - After Effects, Premiere, Audition Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.Experience resizing videos for different, audio correction/mixing, color correction, editing with music, and delivering polished final edits.Strong visual sensibility/awareness, including an understanding of branding, color, typography, composition, and musicComfortable working in a fast-paced environment with tight turnaround times/deadlines and prioritizing multiple tasks/assignmentsStrong project organization with excellent attention to detail and organizational skillsWilling to take and apply direction and constructive feedbackSuperior organization and time management skills.Strong communication skills and a preference for working in teams.Extraordinary attention to detail.Flexibility. No edit is sacred. Circumstances and requirements change.Experience creating political or issue-based videos for digital and TV Willingness to put in that extra time and effort: sometimes we have to work longer days or on weekends, especially during campaign seasons.A bonus but not required:Bilingual: English/SpanishExperience in 2D animation and character riggingExperience working with 3D programs such as Cinema 4D and incorporating 3D assets and animations into video Compensation:The base salary band for this position is $55,000 to $60,000 per year depending on experience. To counter pay inequality and uphold internal parity, we are unable to negotiate on starting salaries. Employer-matched 401(k), no vesting schedule.100% company-paid premiums for employees' health, dental, and vision plans.100% company-paid premiums for life and disability insurance.PTO accrued at 1.25 days per month and 5 days of sick leave, plus company-designated holidays.Work from home monthly stipend.Regular team events. How To Apply:Please reply to jobs@blueprintinteractive.com with PDF versions of your resume, cover letter, and portfolio samples or links. Don't write us a book, but tell us about yourself and why you'd like to work for us. So we can be sure that you've read this whole thing, please title your subject line "Application: Video/Motion Graphics Editor" We're looking forward to hearing from you!
No phone calls or recruiting agencies, please!
We are focused on building a staff that is diverse of race, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin, and all of the other qualities that give us different life experiences. Candidates of color, women, LGBTQI, and more are encouraged to apply.

Experience Level (if available): None
